Investor Relations

Altanine extends a warm welcome to investors

Summary

Executive summary

01

Altanine's Coating Tech: Enhanced Medication Effectiveness

Altanine’s proprietary coating technology allows it to offer existing medications at high levels of bioavailability while mitigating unpleasant side effects

02

Initial focus is on Diabetes and Weight Loss Markets

Large potential patient populations. Existing drug therapies are old, costly to administer and have gastro-intestinal side effects. Low levels of patient compliances risk disease complications and costly, emergency treatment

03

Altanine's Innovative Products Target Market Share

Altanine can grab market share with innovative, cost effective products that should resonate with patients, medical providers and insurance companies

Understanding Diabetes Treatment

The Role of Metformin and Beyond

Diabetes, a chronic disease affecting millions globally, disrupts carbohydrate metabolism, causing high blood glucose levels and leading to complications like heart and kidney diseases, vision problems, and neuropathy. 

The treatment methods for diabetes vary depending on the type of the disease. Type 1 diabetes usually requires regular insulin injections, while Type 2 diabetes can often be managed through lifestyle changes, diet, and the intake of oral hypoglycemic drugs such as Metformin.

Metformin, effective for Type 2 diabetes, lowers blood glucose and aids in weight loss but may cause gastrointestinal side effects, potentially leading to its discontinuation. Despite being generally safe, Metformin can occasionally lead to severe issues like vitamin B12 deficiency or lactic acidosis, especially in those with kidney problems.

About altanine

Altanine – a patient-centric treatment

Altanine increases efficiency and improves patient experience in Metformin treatment

  • Patient-friendly treatment
  • Special patented enteric coating for targeted release
  • Enhanced bioavailability of the medication
  • Improved body absorption
  • Reduced gastrointestinal side effects
  • Lowers the necessary dosage of Metformin

Altanine business model

  • Altanine has engaged Polomar Specialty Pharmacy as its initial compounding pharmacy.
  • Polomar will pay Altanine a fixed royalty for every prescription of Altanine products that it fulfills.
  • As demand warrants, additional compounding pharmacies can be introduced to help fulfill demand for Altanine products.
  • Telehealth platforms that “white label” Altanine products may have their own compounding pharmacies.

Production

Through a Compounding Pharmacy

Distribution

Doctor’s prescription filled and delivered to the patient

Reimbursement

The Compounding Pharmacy bills the insurance company and/or the patient

Additional Pharmacies

Will be brought on to help manage the patient demand, etc.

Entry Plan

Go-to-market strategy

01

Medical Outreach for Innovative Metformin Solution

Presentations to doctors, diabetes specialists and diabetes-related medical conferences to introduce a low cost, highly effective solution for metformin administration and patient compliance.

02

Offer Altanine products on a “white label” basis to telehealth platforms as well as specialty clinics.

This includes Metformin and Liraglutide products.

03

The rollout will expand internationally.

Altanine will seek out international licensing partners for companies that wish to manufacture and offer Altanine products in international markets.

Investor FAQ

For more information on what it means to be a part of our affiliate program, check out our FAQ’s. Still have questions?

How can I invest in your company?

Metformin is the most common drug used and is the first-line agent in type 2 diabetes management. It is also considered one of the safest pharmacological agents for the treatment of the disease.

However, gastrointestinal side effects are common, occurring in up to 75% of those who take metformin (2). These side effects may include diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, abdominal discomfort, and/or flatulence, with severity ranging from mild to severe. These complications are more common with immediate-release preparations of metformin than with its extended-release formulation. Discontinuation and nonadherence rates have been as high as 46% with metformin because of these issues (3).
